pages.text: Haootia quadriformis comes from the late Ediacaran, with fossils found from Newfoundland, Canada. It is a small staurozoan, and could grow up to 6 cm in height, and possibly partook in filter feeding from the surrounding water, or eating any other fauna that were small enough to consume if the need arose.
The generic name derives from the Beothuk word 'Haoot', to mean 'demon'. Its specific name derives from the Latin words 'quadri', to mean 'fourfold'; and 'formis', to mean 'form'.
